Hi Friends, I enjoy reading English articles
as well as teaching English. It means not

only do I enjoy teaching English but also
enjoy reading English articles. Well this

is what today's lesson is about using ‘As
well as’ in a sentence.
Before we start, let's understand what do you mean by ‘As well as’, it means not only but also. Now

we use ‘As well as’ when we want to add
some more information to a fact that is already

known to the person that we are speaking to,
so it means you are adding more information

to some fact. Now a lot of people misunderstand
it as a similar word to and. Now it’s certainly

does not mean ‘and’. So people feel it’s
okay to use and, and as well as interchangeably.

But well friends that is not the case. ‘As
well as’ means ‘Not only, but also’,

so when you add more information to something
you use ‘As well as’. Now in my first

sentence, John as well as Mary wants to leave
early. It means not only Mary but also john.

Now maybe Mary has already taken leave and
she is you know her leave is approved but

now I tell my boss John as well as Mary wants
to leave early. What I mean is not only Mary,

he knows the fact that Mary is leaving early
but not only Mary but also John. I am adding

some information to the fact that Mary wants
to leave early. Wellbut also John. So john

also wants to leave early, fine. Now remember
I have two subjects here John as well as Mary.

In singular Mary is a singular noun, so you
add a singular verb ‘wants to’. A lot

of people would say, John as well as Mary
want to leave early. Well this is wrong. Or

many people would say, ok John and Mary wants
to leave early. Again that is wrong. Why am

I using as well as because I am adding some
more information to a fact that is already

know to the person, in this case it’s my
boss, fine. In the next example, she is greedy

as well as dishonest. That means not only
she is dishonest but also greedy. Now we are

talking about a common person a mutual friend
probably. You already know that she is dishonest,

I am adding some more information and telling
you not only is she greedy, not only is she

dishonest but also greedy. You know the fact
that she is dishonest, I am adding some more

information and telling you she is greedy.
So that is how I am going to use as well as

to say not only but also, ok friends. The
third example, animals as well as plants need

water to survive. Not only plants but also
animals ok, need water to survive, fine. I

am adding some more information to the fact
that plants need water to survive. What’s

the information? Animals also need water to
survive. Now we have two subjects that we

are connecting animals as well as plants.
Plants is in the plural so you are going to

use a plural verb, do not use needs this will
be completely incorrect. So animals as well

as plants need water to survive. Not only
plants but also animals, fine so I am adding

some more information. Now we are going to
take a look at the next information which

is slightly different, he hurt his arm as
well as breaking his leg. So we have two verbs

here there are two actions that are happening.
In my earlier sentences we have two subjects

or two qualities that we are connecting now
we are talking about two actions. He hurt

his arm as well as breaking his leg. Now the
verb that follows as well as always takes

an ‘ing’ form. Now a lot of people would
use, he hurt his arm as well as broke his

leg. This is incorrect. Well this is the most
common error made, but remember when you have

a verb immediately after as well as use an
‘ing’ form. This is very important and

you must remember this rule. Now the next
sentence, she draws as well as designing cloths.

Again I have two words draws as designs. So
not only does she design but also draws, right.

I am adding some more information to the fact
that she designs cloths you know the information,

I am adding some more to it. So she draws
as well as she, as well as designing. Do not

say as well as designs, fine. Again the most
common error this is absolutely incorrect.

Remember the verb that follows as well as
is always in the ‘ing’ form. This is very-very

important as a lot of people make mistake.
So remember when you use a verb immediately

after as well as it should always and always
be in the ‘ing’ form. The next sentence

is again a little different, I have to clean
the floors as well as cook food. Now if you

see in this sentence I have an infinity here,
so to clean is an infinity. So what is an

infinity, it is to followed by a verb in the
base form. So I have to clean. So it’s like

I have to go, I want to eat some chips. So
to go, to eat become infinitives. So it nothing

but to plus a verb in the base form, in this
case it is clean. So I have to clean the floors

as well as cook food. Now I have an infinity
in the main clause, so when you have the second

verb here you do no use to. You do not use
to. Now just supposing I was to make two sentences,

I would say I have to clean the floors. I
have to cook food. So have, I have to cook.

But now I am using as well as to ass some
more information, so I am going to say I have

to clean the floors as well as cook food.
So you do not add ‘to’, do not say ‘to

cook’. This is absolutely incorrect. And
in this case you do not put cook in ing because

we are dealing with an infinity in the main
clause or in the main part of the sentence.

So this is not a verb, it’s an infinitive.
What is an infinitive, to followed by a verb

in the base form. Because there is an infinitive
in the main clause you will not use ‘to

cook’. That means the infinitive form after
as well as you will just put it without ‘to’,

you would use the verb without ‘to’ and
remember in this case you will not put the

verb in the ‘ing’ form because we are
dealing with an infinitives in this sentence.

Okay friends. Now let me give you one more
sentence. Well, I have to go. So I have to

go as well as end the lesson. Now why am I
saying as well as. You are aware of the fact

that I have to end the lesson but well I am
adding information by telling you not only

do I have to end the lesson but also its time
to go. Well this brings me to the end of the

lesson. Hope you enjoyed watching it. I do
have a small test for you take it and let

me know you scores. I’ll be back soon with
a new lesson till then take care and bye.
